Generation IV.Diamond: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
Generation IV.Platinum: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.

Generation VI.X: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
Generation VI.Y: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.

Generation VII.Sun: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidos's.
Generation VII.Moon: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its powerful headbutt has enough force to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Stifled by a thick skull that can withstand any impact, this Pokémon’s brain never got very big.
Generation IX.Violet: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
